questions.question: ‘I haven’t paid the fee.’ ‘I haven’t ……………………’
questions.description: After a negative remark we can express another negative remark with neither or not either.

questions.question: Her husband is ten years ………………………… than her.
questions.description: Elder and eldest can only be used before nouns (attributively).

questions.question: ‘Nice movie?’ ‘ ………………………………, it was a complete waste of time.’
questions.description: We use on the contrary to contradict a suggestion/opinion made by another speaker.

questions.question: The train was late. ………………………….. this, we managed to reach on time.
questions.description: We can use in spite of to introduce something which sounds surprising in view of what was said before.

questions.question: Although she is eighty, she enjoys ………………………………
questions.description: We do not normally use articles with uncountable nouns.

questions.question: She has got ………………………… for the job.
questions.description: When enough is an adjective, it goes before the noun it modifies.

questions.question: There is no question of …………………………. resigning from the job.
Do you dare …………………………. your mind to the test?
questions.description: When dare is used as an ordinary verb, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: Have you bought the …………………………?
questions.description: Groceries is not normally used in the plural form.

questions.question: ‘Can I give you a lift?’ ‘No thanks, I would prefer ………………………….’
questions.description: We use a to-infinitive after would prefer.

questions.question: I hate ………………………….. at weekends.
questions.description: After hate, both infinitives and ing forms can be used.
